other.description: At the end of the Fight phase, if there are no models currently embarked within this Transport, you can select one friendly Drukhari Infantry unit that has 6 or fewer models that is wholly within 6" of this Transport (you cannot select a Grotesques unit or a unit that can Fly). Unless that unit is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can embark within this Transport.
other.name: Athletic Aerialists

datasheets.fluff: Raw speed delivers countless light Venom transports to the heart of the enemy’s defence, and sees them chase down stragglers and encircle the foe’s outriders. For the clique of warriors on board, Venoms are mobile firebases and gore-splashed chariots in one, with flickering shields that confound attempts to bring them down.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: splinter cannon; twin splinter rifle; bladevanes.
datasheets.name: Venom
datasheets.transport:
This model has a transport capacity of 6 Drukhari Infantry models. This model cannot transport Grotesque models or models that can Fly.

Before the battle, at the start of the Declare Battle Formations step, you can select one Kabalite Warriors or Wyches unit from your army. If you do, that unit is split into two units, each containing as equal a number of models as possible (when splitting a unit in this way, make a note of which models form each of the two new units). One of these units must start the battle embarked within this Transport; the other can start the battle embarked within another Transport, or it can be deployed as a separate unit.
wargear: This model’s twin splinter rifle can be replaced with 1 splinter cannon.

other.description: Each time a Pain token is removed from your Pain token pool to Empower a unit, if that Empowered unit is within 9" of this unit, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain 1 Pain token.
other.name: Pain Parasite (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Like other Engines of Pain, the Cronos is a grisly amalgam of stimm-fed flesh and biomechanical implements shielded by a burnished carapace. Haemonculi create the Cronos to act as a parasite. Its esoteric syphons leech its victim’s life essence, leaving them as husks before projecting the stolen vitality to other Drukhari.
datasheets.loadout: Every Cronos is equipped with: spirit syphon; spirit-leech tentacles.
datasheets.name: Cronos
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 spirit vortex.

other.description: If this unit destroys an enemy unit, until the end of the battle, it is Empowered.
other.name: Pain Engine

datasheets.fluff: The Talos Pain Engine is a ghoulish melding of stitch-puckered flesh and armoured artifice, boasting tremendous resilience and a nightmarish array of weaponry. Each is the proud creation of the Drukhari Haemonculi, who employ their Talos as torture devices, surgical assistants and armoured murder machines.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: twin splinter cannon; 2 macro-scalpels.
datasheets.name: Talos
wargear: Any number of models can each replace one of their macro-scalpels with one of the following: ◦ 1 Talos ichor injector ◦ 1 twin liquifier gun
Any number of models can each replace one of their macro-scalpels with one of the following: ◦ 1 chain-flails ◦ 1 Talos gauntlet
Any number of models can each replace their twin splinter cannon with one of the following: ◦ 1 twin Drukhari haywire blasters ◦ 1 twin heat lance ◦ 1 stinger pod

other.description: Each time this model Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of this model.
other.name: Aethersails

datasheets.fluff: The Raider is a favoured transport cutter amongst the Drukhari. Its passengers loose shots from the trophy-hung decking as it speeds upon anti-grav turbines into the fighting. While its cargo of warriors leap into the fray, the Raider unleashes its heavy weaponry and flays enemies below with chain-snares and bladevanes.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: dark lance; bladevanes.
datasheets.name: Raider
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 11 Drukhari Infantry models. Each Grotesque model takes up the space of 3 models. This model cannot transport models that can Fly.
wargear: This model’s dark lance can be replaced with 1 disintegrator cannon.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time it makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that is at its Starting Strength, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If the target unit has a Starting Strength of 1, this ability only applies if that unit has its starting number of wounds.
other.name: Eradicate the Foe

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: storm vortex projector; bladevanes; prow blade.
datasheets.name: Reaper
wargear: None

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time it makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that is at its Starting Strength, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If a unit has a Starting Strength of 1, this ability only applies if the target has its starting number of wounds.
other.name: Eradicate the Foe

datasheets.fluff: Ravager gunships fulfil the role of armoured support during Drukhari raids, yet these grav-skiffs also possess the speed and agility to outmanoeuvre the enemy’s lumbering equivalents. They are mobile assassins, mounting enough firepower to gut enemy tanks and eradicate the foe’s elite, before swiftly moving to new hunting grounds.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 3 dark lances; bladevanes.
datasheets.name: Ravager
wargear: Any number of this model’s dark lances can each be replaced with 1 disintegrator cannon.

other.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a unit that cannot Fly, add 1 to the Hit roll.
other.name: Strafing Run

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 dark lances; splinterstorm cannon; Bladed wings.
datasheets.name: Raven Strike Fighter
wargear: None

other.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit (excluding units that can Fly), add 1 to the Hit roll.
other.name: Ground Attack Craft

datasheets.fluff: These lightning-fast ground attack craft unleash widespread slaughter and disruption with flurries of diverse missiles. Archons call in their strikes to fracture the lesser races’ attempts at organised resistance, and their speed-addicted pilots also indulge in hunting down lumbering tanks and monstrosities with multiple heavy cannons.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 dark lances; Razorwing missiles; twin splinter rifle; bladed wings.
datasheets.name: Razorwing Jetfighter
wargear: This model’s 2 dark lances can be replaced with 2 disintegrator cannons.
This model’s twin splinter rifle can be replaced with 1 splinter cannon.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Once per battle, after this unit ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy model it moved over during that move and roll one D6 for each enemy unit within D6" of that enemy model: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
other.name: Void Mine

datasheets.fluff: Mounting some of the most powerful guns in the Drukhari arsenal, the Voidraven Bomber’s dark scythes and void lances can crack heavily armoured targets. Yet they pale against the silent aircraft’s primary weapon – the void mine. Once this arcane payload is deployed, the resulting darklight implosion erases all caught within its blast.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 void lances; bladed wings.
datasheets.name: Voidraven Bomber
wargear: The model’s 2 void lances can be replaced with 2 dark scythes.
This model can be equipped with 1 Voidraven missiles.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time it makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it and roll one D6: on a 2-3, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 4-5, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Scything Charge

datasheets.fluff: The Tantalus is a prestigious twin-hulled Drukhari assault skimmer perfectly crafted for high-speed terror raids. The signature armament of the Tantalus is a set of graceful scythevanes that extend from the vehicle’s hull, designed to slice and sever any foes caught in the skimmer’s sweeping flight path.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: pulse disintegrators; dire scythe blades.
datasheets.name: Tantalus
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 16 Drukhari Infantry models. Each Grotesque model takes up the space of 3 models. This model cannot transport models that can Fly.
wargear: None

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, if it is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6". If it does, until the end of the turn, this unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
other.name: Winged Strike

datasheets.fluff: Airborne messengers and mercenaries who ride the thermals between Commorragh’s highest spires, Scourges have been bodily modified for winged flight. They wear their grotesque new forms with the same pride that they wield their massive dark lances and splinter cannons, for their combination of speed and firepower renders them invaluable.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: shardcarbine; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Scourges
wargear: The Solarite can be equipped with 1 Solarite weapon.
The Solarite can replace its shardcarbine with one of the following: ◦ 1 blast pistol ◦ 1 splinter pistol
Up to 4 Scourges can each replace their shardcarbine with one of the following: ◦ 1 blaster ◦ 1 dark lance ◦ 1 Drukhari haywire blaster ◦ 1 heat lance ◦ 1 shredder ◦ 1 splinter cannon

other.description: At the end of your Movement phase, this model can heal one friendly Cronos, Talos, Grotesques or Wracks unit within 6". If it does, one model in that unit regains up to 3 lost wounds (if you selected a Wracks unit, up to 3 destroyed models are returned to that unit instead).
other.name: Fleshcraft

other.description: The first time this model is destroyed, roll one D6 at the end of the phase. On a 2+, set this model back up on the battlefield, as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, with its full wounds remaining.
other.name: Horrific Regeneration

datasheets.fluff: Urien Rakarth is the most ingenious of the many Haemonculi masters. He is the Sculptor of Torments, whose repugnant creations strain his enemies’ sanity. Once his casket of fanged spirits and his toxin-laced blades are finished, a coiling nest of Haemovores feast upon whatever is left of Rakarth’s foes.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Wracks
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Casket of Flensing; Haemonculus tools and scissorhands.
datasheets.name: Urien Rakarth

abilities.description: The bearer can only shoot with this weapon once per battle.
abilities.name: One Shot

wargear: None

other.description: While an enemy unit is within 6" of this model, each time a Battle-shock or Leadership test is taken for that enemy unit, subtract 1 from that test.
other.name: Fear Incarnate (Aura)

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.
other.name: Master of Pain

datasheets.fluff: Wielding arrays of horrific implements from their personal oubliettes and laboratories, Haemonculi drift like sinister predators in battle. They direct their Covens of twisted monstrosities and pain-adepts while hungrily seeking out fresh subjects for their hideous fleshcrafting.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Wracks
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: stinger pistol; Haemonculus tools and scissorhands.
datasheets.name: Haemonculus
wargear: None

other.description: Each time a model in this unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6. On a 4+, do not remove it from play; that destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and it is then removed from play.
other.name: Mindless Killing Machines

datasheets.fluff: These modified meat-hulks are pumped full of painful chemicals, growth elixirs and macro-steroids. With swollen muscles they hack their master’s foes apart, their brutal cleavers and grafted claws dripping with toxins. They are mindlessly obedient and insensible to any hurt, chasing down fleeing prey at the behest of their creator.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: monstrous weapons.
datasheets.name: Grotesques
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 liquifier gun.

other.description: Each time this unit destroys an enemy unit, you gain 1 Pain token. When this unit is destroyed, you gain 1 Pain token.
other.name: The Torturer’s Craft

datasheets.fluff: The gnarled hide of the Wracks is a leathery mass of old scars, inured to pain. These adepts of fleshcrafting serve wizened masters of the Covens, and are as much experiments as they are apprentices. They are granted a host of gruesome tools, butchering blades and arcane bio-weapons with which they inflict maximum agony.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Wrack blades.
datasheets.name: Wracks
wargear: For every 5 models in the unit: ◦ 1 model can be equipped with 1 hexrifle* ◦ 1 model can be equipped with 1 liquifier gun* ◦ 1 model can be equipped with 1 ossefactor* ◦ 1 model can be equipped with 1 stinger pistol*  * Each model cannot be equipped with more than 1 ranged weapon.

other.description: Once per battle, at the start of the Fight phase, this model can use this ability. When it does, until the end of the phase, the Attacks characteristic of Lelith’s blades is increased to 12 and this model’s invulnerable save is increased to 3+.
other.name: Thrilling Spectacle

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Fights First ability, and each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack and improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
other.name: Brides of Death

datasheets.fluff: Lelith Hesperax’s lithe athleticism is far beyond that of other Wyches. She has raised death to a high art, wielding nothing more than simple knives. Gifting her victims with precision wounds in an exotic blur of blades and flesh, she finishes in a bloody finale with a gory flourish.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Wyches
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Lelith’s blades.
datasheets.name: Lelith Hesperax
wargear: None

other.description: At the end of your opponent’s turn, if this unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove this unit from the battlefield. In the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models. If the battle ends and this unit is not on the battlefield, it is destroyed.
other.name: Fade Away

datasheets.fluff: Creatures of midnight horror, crawling from their shadow realm into the most secure locations, Mandrakes radiate an aura of frigid evil. Baleful runes carved into their shadowy flesh blaze with power, chilling their enemies’ souls before these faceless reapers’ icy blades and claws flense the skin from their victims.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: baleblast; glimmersteel blade.
datasheets.name: Mandrakes
wargear: None

other.description: If this model is Empowered in the Fight phase, then until the end of the phase, models in this model’s unit, have the Fights First ability.
other.name: Combat Drugs

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.
other.name: Storm of Blades

datasheets.fluff: Succubi are the leaders of the Wych Cults and master combatants of the arena, possessing both sublime and bloody artistry. They are versed in countless forms of death and give visceral displays of acrobatic lethality. With lightning-fast reactions and a variety of outlandish weapons, they revel in their own superiority.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Wyches
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Succubus weapons.
datasheets.name: Succubus
wargear: This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 blast pistol ◦ 1 splinter pistol

other.description: Once per battle, when this model’s unit is selected to fight, it can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by this model have the [PRECISION] ability, and each time an enemy Character model is destroyed by this model, you gain D3 Pain tokens. If that destroyed Character model was the enemy Warlord, you gain 3 Pain tokens instead.
other.name: Vicious Execution

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.
other.name: Master of Blades

datasheets.fluff: Drazhar is the sinister and silent Executioner of the Incubi. A merciless blademaster, his lightning-fast assaults chew through masses of lesser warriors. Those chosen as Drazhar’s prey have only seconds to live.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Incubi
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: the Executioner’s demiklaives.
datasheets.name: Drazhar
wargear: None

invul.info: You cannot re-roll invulnerable saving throws made for this model. The first time an invulnerable saving throw made for this model is failed, until the end of the battle, this model has no invulnerable saving throw.

other.description: Once per battle, after your opponent uses a Stratagem, if this model is your Warlord and is on the battlefield, it can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the battle, increase the cost of that Stratagem to your opponent by 1CP.
other.name: Devious Mastermind

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. While that unit is Empowered, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.
other.name: Overlord

datasheets.fluff: Archons apply the same inventive malice with which they rule the fractured Kabals to their enemies on the battlefield. Leading many realspace raids, Archons arrogantly dare their enemies to face their martial expertise, their arsenal of eldritch weapons and the labyrinthine cunning that has enabled their rise to power.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Court of the Archon ■ Incubi ■ Kabalite Warriors
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: splinter pistol; huskblade.
datasheets.name: Archon
wargear: This model’s splinter pistol can be replaced with 1 blast pistol.

other.description: While this unit contains a Beastmaster model, you can re-roll Charge rolls made for this unit, and each time a Beast model in this unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.
other.name: Beastmaster

datasheets.fluff: On thrumming skyboards that spit venom-laced shards, Beastmasters hover above the frenzied bloodletting of their thrall-creatures, goading them on with the cruel lashes of a nerve-inflaming agoniser. Many wear shamanistic masks that augment the wearer’s natural dominance with sub-vocal emissions and subjugating pheromones.
datasheets.loadout:
The Beastmaster is equipped with: splinter pods; agoniser.
Every Clawed Fiend is equipped with: Clawed Fiend fists.
Every Khymerae is equipped with: Khymerae talons.
Every Razorwing Flock is equipped with: Razorwing feathers.
datasheets.name: Beastmaster
wargear: None

other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, each enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more units with this ability must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Tormentors

datasheets.fluff: The Incubi are warrior-perfectionists of the highest order. Protected by the ornate plates of their ancient warsuits, they move swiftly in for the kill, sweeping giant klaives in practised, decapitating strikes. They carve straight through the enemy’s elite, crushing their spirit with psychic torture devices known as tormentors.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: klaive.
datasheets.name: Incubi
wargear: The Klaivex’s klaive can be replaced with 1 demilklaives.

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, if any of those attacks made with its eyeburst scored a hit against an enemy Infantry unit, that Infantry unit must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Medusae

other.description: While this unit contains one or more Lhamaean models, weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
other.name: Lhamaean

other.description: While this unit contains one or more Sslyth models, each time an attack targets this unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
other.name: Sslyth

other.description: While this unit contains one or more Ur-ghul models, this unit has the Fights First ability.
other.name: Ur-ghul

special.description: In the Declare Battle Formations step, this unit can join one Kabalite Warriors unit from your army that is being led by an Archon (a Kabalite Warriors unit cannot have more than one Court of the Archon unit joined to it). If it does, until the end of the battle, every model in this unit counts as part of that Kabalite Warriors unit, and its Starting Strength is increased accordingly.
special.name: Court of the Archon

datasheets.fluff: Nothing but the manipulative cunning of an Archon could demand the loyalty of their varied Courts. Drawn from diverse mercenary factions that inhabit Commorragh, Drukhari, aliens and other horrors protect their liege with all manner of twisted weapons, flesh-eating venoms, needle-like fangs and empathic leaching.
datasheets.loadout:
A Lhamaean is equipped with: shaimeshi blade.
A Medusae is equipped with: eyeburst; close combat weapon.
A Sslyth is equipped with: shardcarbine; splinter pistol; Sslyth battle-blade.
An Ur-ghul is equipped with: Ur-ghul talons.
datasheets.name: Court of the Archon
wargear: None

other.description: Each time this unit ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit (excluding Monster and Vehicle units) that it moved over during that move. If you do, roll one D6 for each model in this unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
other.name: Eviscerating Fly-by

wargear.description: Each time you roll to inflict wounds using this unit’s Eviscerating Fly-by ability, you can re-roll one D6 for each model in this unit equipped with cluster caltrops.
wargear.name: Cluster caltrops

wargear.description: Each time you roll to inflict wounds using this unit’s Eviscerating Fly-by ability, you can re-roll one D6 for each model in this unit equipped with cluster caltrops.
wargear.name: Cluster caltrops

wargear.description: The bearer’s melee weapons have the [LANCE] ability.
wargear.name: Grav-talon

wargear.description: The bearer’s melee weapons have the [LANCE] ability.
wargear.name: Grav-talon

datasheets.fluff: Reaver jetbikes streak across the battlefield with the same speed and agility they display during their lethal races around the Commorrite arenas. Whether jinking around incoming enemy fire, decapitating foes with vicious bladevanes or culling their victims with ferocious firepower, these high-speed killers are lethal in the extreme.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: splinter pistol; splinter rifle; bladevanes.
datasheets.name: Reavers
wargear: For every 3 models in this unit, 1 model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 grav-talon ◦ 1 cluster caltrops
For every 3 models in this unit, 1 model’s splinter rifle can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 blaster ◦ 1 heat lance
The Arena Champion can be equipped with 1 agoniser.

other.description: If you control an objective marker at the end of your Command phase, and this unit (or any Transport it is embarked within) is within range of that objective marker, that objective marker remains under you control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.
other.name: Sadistic Raiders

wargear.description: The bearer’s unit has the Grenades keyword.
wargear.name: Phantasm grenade launcher

datasheets.fluff: Clad from head to foot in blade-edged, segmented armour, Kabalite Warriors are an intimidating, arachnoid presence. They are highly skilled, cruel enforcers who unleash hails of toxin-coated shards during swift and agile advances, driving terrified prey before them at their master’s whim.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: splinter rifle; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Kabalite Warriors
wargear: 1 Kabalite Warrior’s splinter rifle can be replaced with 1 blaster.
1 Kabalite Warrior’s splinter rifle can be replaced with 1 dark lance.
1 Kabalite Warrior’s splinter rifle can be replaced with 1 shredder.
1 Kabalite Warrior’s splinter rifle can be replaced with 1 splinter cannon.
The Sybarite can be equipped with 1 phantasm grenade launcher.
The Sybarite’s close combat weapon can be replaced with 1 Sybarite weapon.
The Sybarite’s splinter rifle can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 blast pistol ◦ 1 splinter pistol

other.description: This unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
other.name: Hit and Run

wargear.description: The bearer’s unit has the Grenades keyword.
wargear.name: Phantasm grenade launcher

datasheets.fluff: When the Hellion gangs ride their bladed skyboards alongside Drukhari raiding parties, they bring terror to the battlefields of realspace. Arrogant and agile, Hellions wield their hellglaives with such skill that battle becomes a contest as to who can perform the most ostentatious acts of battlefield butchery.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: splinter pods; hellglaive.
datasheets.name: Hellions
wargear: The Helliarch can be equipped with 1 phantasm grenade launcher.
The Helliarch’s hellglaive can be replaced with 1 splinter pistol and 1 Helliarch weapon.

invul.info: The invulnerable save that models in this unit have is improved to a 4+ against melee attacks.

other.description: Each time an enemy unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army with this ability is selected to Fall Back, models in that enemy unit must take Desperate Escape tests as if their unit was Battle-shocked. When doing so, if that enemy unit is also Battle-shocked by other means, subtract 1 from each of those Desperate Escape tests.
other.name: No Escape

wargear.description: The bearer’s unit has the Grenades keyword.
wargear.name: Phantasm grenade launcher

datasheets.fluff: The dancers of death, Wyches are acrobatic murder-artists, exhibiting their incredible arena skills to slay with precision and élan. They wield exotic weapons – hooks, barbed chains or flensing blades – that require superior ability. These are deadly in Wyches’ hands as they dart, twist and blur around their foes’ clumsy attacks.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: splinter pistol; Hekatarii blade.
datasheets.name: Wyches
wargear: The Hekatrix can be equipped with 1 phantasm grenade launcher.
The Hekatrix’s splinter pistol can be replaced with 1 blast pistol.

enhancements.description: DRUKHARI model only. Each time the bearer’s unit destroys an enemy unit in the Fight phase, if that enemy unit was within range of one or more objective markers when the bearer’s unit was selected to fight, you gain 1 additional Pain token.
enhancements.name: Spiteful Raider

enhancements.description: Haemonculus model only. Once per battle, at the start of any Shooting phase, the bearer can use this Enhancement. When it does, every enemy unit within 12" must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from that test if the bearer’s unit is currently Empowered. Each time a PSYKER unit fails this test, it suffers D3 mortal wounds.
enhancements.name: Crucible of Malediction

enhancements.description: DRUKHARI model only. Each time you expend a Pain token to Empower the bearer’s unit in the Shooting phase, you can select one friendly DRUKHARI TRANSPORT within 3" of the bearer’s unit; until the end of the phase, that TRANSPORT is also Empowered.
enhancements.name: Sadistic Fulcrum

enhancements.description: DRUKHARI model only. Each time the bearer’s unit disembarks from a TRANSPORT, until the end of the turn, enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at the bearer’s unit.
enhancements.name: Nightmare Shroud

enhancements.description: DRUKHARI model only. While the bearer’s unit is wholly within 6" of a friendly DRUKHARI TRANSPORT, models in the bearer’s unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.
enhancements.name: Phantasmal Smoke

enhancements.description: Succubus model only. Improve the Attacks and Armour Penetration characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons by 1. While the bearer is Empowered, improve the Attacks and Armour Penetration characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons by 2 instead.
enhancements.name: Blood Dancer

enhancements.description: Drukhari model only. In your Command phase, if the bearer is on the battlefield, you gain 1 Pain token.
enhancements.name: The Art of Pain

enhancements.description: Archon model only. Each time you select the bearer’s unit as the target of a Stratagem, roll one D6, adding 3 to the result if the Stratagem being used is Alliance of Agony. On a 4+, you gain 1 Command Point.
enhancements.name: Labyrinthine Cunning

stratagems.effect: Discard one Pain token from your Pain token pool. Until the end of the phase, all three of those models’ units are Empowered.
stratagems.fluff: Even the most bloodthirsty Drukhari will veil their enmity to work together against a shared enemy for the same gruesome purpose.
stratagems.name: ALLIANCE OF AGONY
stratagems.restrictions: You can only use this Stratagem if you are able to select all three of the target models stated above.
stratagems.target: One ARCHON, one SUCCUBUS and one HAEMONCULUS from your army.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: The scent of a foe in pain draws Drukhari to it like hungry predators to an injured beast, their senses sharpening at its tang.
stratagems.name: PREY ON THE WEAK
stratagems.target: One KABAL unit from your army and one enemy unit that is Below Half-strength.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: The twisted creations of the Haemonculus Covens are insensible to all but the most mortal injuries.
stratagems.name: INSENSIBLE TO PAIN
stratagems.target: One HAEMONCULUS COVENS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: The hyper-fast reflexes of the Drukhari allow them to duck and weave to avoid all but the swiftest enemy strikes.
stratagems.name: QUICKSILVER REACTIONS
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot target a HAEMONCULUS COVENS unit from your army for this Stratagem.
stratagems.target: One DRUKHARI unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even if it Fell Back or Advanced this turn.
stratagems.fluff: Many Wych Cults favour spectacular gymnastic displays. Their fighters are never still, springing from one foot to the other at blinding speed.
stratagems.name: ACROBATIC DISPLAY
stratagems.target: One WYCH CULT unit from your army.

stratagems.effect: After your TRANSPORT has fought, select one enemy unit that was the target of one or more of those attacks and roll one D6 for each model embarked within your TRANSPORT, adding 1 to the result if that embarked model is a WRACKS model: for each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).
stratagems.fluff: Wielding a horrifying array of hooked boarding blades, barbed lariats and other specialised tools of agony, these warriors hack and slash at their foes even as their transport skims low overhead.
stratagems.name: VICIOUS BLADES
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after a DRUKHARI TRANSPORT from your army has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, or the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead if it is a KABALITE WARRIORS unit.
stratagems.fluff: These warriors are well versed in raining suppressing fire on the foe even as they close with them from on high, shredding defences and leaving the survivors easy prey for the raid.
stratagems.name: SKYBORNE ANNIHILATION
stratagems.target: One DRUKHARI unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit has a 4+ invulnerable save.
stratagems.fluff: These powerful Drukhari devices occlude their raiding vehicles not only from physical sight but also targeting sensors and even psychic senses.
stratagems.name: NIGHT SHIELD
stratagems.target: One DRUKHARI VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge.
stratagems.fluff: Incredible alien agility and a delight in taking wild risks help these warriors to leap acrobatically from their skimming transports directly into battle.
stratagems.name: POUNCE ON THE PREY
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a DRUKHARI INFANTRY unit from your army disembarks from a TRANSPORT that made a Normal move this phase.

stratagems.effect: Your TRANSPORT can make a Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.fluff: The crew of this skimmer delight in evading and taunting their enemies with mocking ease.
stratagems.name: SWOOPING MOCKERY
stratagems.target: One DRUKHARI TRANSPORT from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.

stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal or Fall Back move, but unless it is a WYCHES unit, it must end that move wholly within 3" horizontally and 5" vertically of a friendly DRUKHARI TRANSPORT and must embark within that TRANSPORT at the end of that move.
stratagems.fluff: Employing smoke grenades, paralysing mists or simple cunning and agility, these warriors slip away like spectres.
stratagems.name: WRAITHLIKE RETREAT
stratagems.target: One DRUKHARI INFANTRY unit from your army that fought this phase.

stratagems.effect: Your unit can immediately make a Normal move.
stratagems.fluff: The Drukhari are masters at using hit-and-run tactics, engaging a target with a flurry of shots before quickly manoeuvring into cover or out of sight.
stratagems.name: STRIKE AND FADE
stratagems.restrictions: Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge and that unit cannot embark within a TRANSPORT at the end of this move.
stratagems.target: One DRUKHARI unit from your army (excluding AIRCRAFT).
